availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Matthew Mullins (Pendleton County, Kentucky, circuit clerk)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, circuit clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Ann McGill Mullins in Pendleton County on September 27, 1852. Father of Mary J. Mullins, Sallie K. Mullins, and Kate Mullins. Clerk of the Pendleton County Court in Pendleton County in 1855. Clerk of the Pendleton Circuit Court in Pendleton County from c1855 to 1860. Served in the 40th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Lieutenant Colonel from June 15, 1863 to December 30, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton, Falmouth, p. 1.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994052, Pendleton County Marriages, p. unknown.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1855,” in 1856 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: A. G. Hodges, State Printer, 1856), 355-357.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1859,” in 1860 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1860), 291.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1860,” in 1861 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1861), 357.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 433.
Find A Grave, "Matthew Mullins (1827-1903)," Memorial #9376776, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9376776 (accessed May 1, 2018).
